definition: that which is yearned for by the public
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Xiang
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: Reunification of China today is consonant with popular sentiment and the general trend of development.
sentences.chinese: 今天，實現中國的統一，是人心所向，大勢所趨。

sentences.english: Maintain peace and stability on the Korean peninsula is people oriented.
sentences.chinese: 維護朝鮮半島和平穩定是人心所向。

sentences.english: Cracking down upon the crime of accepting bribes is the popular sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 嚴厲打擊受賄犯罪是人心所向。

definition: popular sentiment
not to enjoy popular support/to be unpopular
a just cause enjoys abundant support (idiom); those upholding justice will find help all around
public opinion/popular will/public will
A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)
pinyin: de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4 , shi1 dao4 gua3 zhu4

definition: long-term peace and stability (of governments)
efficient government, people at peace (idiom); all is well with the state and the people
current situation/circumstances/current trend

to endorse/to support
a national policy
power holder/current political ruler
an unjust cause finds little support (idiom, from Mencius)/cf 得道多助[de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4] a just cause attracts much support
